description: Ms. codex. Title from inscription on fol. 1a (later hand). Physical description: 21 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink with use of red. The text is framed in gold outlined in black. European paper with watermark. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Thānī 531". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 1167". Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on 14 R[ajab] 1192 [Aug. 7, 1778] (fol. 23b). Incipit: يا حى يا قيوم بسم ... الحمد لله رب العالمين والصلاة والسلام ... وبعد فيقول العبد الفقير الى مولاه الغنى ابو الاخلاص حسن الشرينبلالى الحنفى انه التمس منى بعض الاخلا ... ان اعمل مقدمة فى العبادات تقرب على المبتدى ... كتاب الطهارة المياه التى يجوز التطهير بها سبع مياه Incipit Riwāyāt al-udá (fol. 24a): حازي رت ايوب انى حسنى الضر وانت ارحم الرحمين
author: Shurunbulālī, Ḥasan ibn ʻAmmār, 1585 or 1586-1659
abstract: Treatise on ʻibādāt. According to the end of the text, the work was completed on Friday, 14(?) Jumādá al-Ūlá 1032 [March 1623] (fol. 23b). The text is followed on fol. 24a-b by a prayer in ottoman Turkish, entitled "Riwāyāt al-udá", written by a later hand.
extent: 25 leaves : paper ; 210 x 140 (170 x 111) mm. bound to 210 x 145 mm.

binding_note: Dark brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers. Silver tooled central lozenge consisting of knot-work, with flecks and long lines developing from its corners. Outer frame consists of a gold tooled fillet and a guilloche. Yellow paper pastedown.
